ICS
It's that time of year again! üéâ We're back with another summer partnership with
St. Augustine Distillery
and
Friends of Tomoka Basin State Parks
for our 'Drink Like a Local' summer cocktail series!
Just like years past, we will have a limited-time cocktail menu for the month of July to help you 'Drink Like a Local' and with every drink purchase, $1 will be donated to Friends of Tomoka Basin State Parks and their mission to promote activities to conserve, enhance, and interpret the cultural, historic, natural, scenic, and recreational resources of the Tomoka Basin State Parks.
You drink, we donate! Click
HERE
for the drink menu.

We‚Äôre rounding out the end of our Mardi Gras & Bike Week celebrations with Derek Trull & EasyStreet!
If you like the music of Lynyrd Skynyrd, Red Clay Strays, The Commodores, Keith Urban, Niko Moon, Jerry Reed, The Eagles, Morgan Wallen, Elvie Shane, ¬†Bill Withers, Prince, Elvis, Kid Rock, Stevie Ray Vaughn, Delbert McClinton, Tracy Chapman, Los Lonely Boys, Stevie Wonder, BB King, Brooks & Dunn, Tab Benoit, Chris Stapleton, The Allman Brothers, Otis Reading, Elton John, Joe Cocker, Joe Bonamassa, Aretha Franklin, Eric Clapton, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Johnny Cash, The Marshall Tucker Band, Bob Seger -
then you will love the variety of music delivered by EasyStreet
.
EasyStreet consists of 4 outstanding musicians who have played all over the world. With lead vocals and 4 part harmonies and arrangements, they will bring you to your feet and keep you dancing all night long!

2nd Annual Souper Bowl Presented by Community Cats of Palm Coast
Sunday, February 2, 2025
2:00‚ÄØPM
4:00‚ÄØPM
RiverGrille on the Tomoka
950 U.S. 1
Ormond Beach, FL, 32174
United States
(map)
Google Calendar
ICS
RiverGrille will be hosting Community Cats of Palm Coast's second annual Souper Bowl on Sunday, February 2nd from 2PM-4PM!
A $20 entry fee supports Community Cats of Palm Coast and includes a cup of soup with crackers, domestic beer or house wine, AND the first 100 guests receive a handmade bowl donated by Down to Earth Pottery!
Community Cats of Palm Coast was founded in 2013 with the goal of reducing the homeless cat population in Flagler County. CCOPC has since grown to become the largest foster-based cat rescue serving the county, providing a chance for cats and kittens to live their lives as beloved pets, and humanely lowering the number of local stray and feral cats through spay/neuter and TNR efforts. CCOPC is a non-profit organization that relies solely on donations and fundraising to continue helping cats in the local community so come out and enjoy music, food, drinks, raffles, and help support Community Cats of Palm Coast!

RiverGrille will be hosting Community Cats of Palm Coast's second annual Souper Bowl on Sunday, February 2nd from 2PM-4PM!
A $20 entry fee supports Community Cats of Palm Coast and includes a cup of soup with crackers, domestic beer or house wine, AND the first 100 guests receive a handmade bowl donated by Down to Earth Pottery!
Community Cats of Palm Coast was founded in 2013 with the goal of reducing the homeless cat population in Flagler County. CCOPC has since grown to become the largest foster-based cat rescue serving the county, providing a chance for cats and kittens to live their lives as beloved pets, and humanely lowering the number of local stray and feral cats through spay/neuter and TNR efforts. CCOPC is a non-profit organization that relies solely on donations and fundraising to continue helping cats in the local community so come out and enjoy music, food, drinks, raffles, and help support Community Cats of Palm Coast!

Let the good times roll with a Mardi Gras x Bike Week celebration at RiverGrille on the Tomoka from Sunday, February 28th to Sunday, March 9th!
We will have food and drinks specials benefitting Friends of the Tomoka Basin State Parks, live music, and much more!
Food Specials
Cafe du Monde Beignets
- Fluffy beignets topped with powdered sugar & served with Cafe du Monde dipping sauce. ($10)
Shrimp & Crawfish √âtouff√©e
- Shrimp & crawfish in a slightly spicy √©touff√©e sauce with white rice. ($22)
Bayou Flatbread - Voodoo sauce topped with Cajun shrimp, andouille, cheese, peppers, onions, & Cajun ranch. ($16)
Cajun Ribeye
- 14oz ribeye topped with Cajun compound butter. Served with 2 sides. ($34)
Smokehouse Sampler
- Smoked in house spare ribs, pulled pork, & chicken wings with your choice of Sweet BBQ or Carolina Gold. Served with fries & slaw. ($18)
Drink Specials
Abita AndyGator ($5)
Bayou Spiced Tea - Bayou spiced rum, sweet tea, & peach puree. ($9)
Cafe du Monde Martini - Freshly brewed Cafe du Monde coffee, coffee liqueur, & vanilla vodka. ($10)
Live Music
Derek Trull and EasyStreet: Sunday, March 9th 5-8pm
For every sale from our special Mardi Gras & Bike Week menu, we will be donating $1 to Friends of Tomoka Basin State Parks! Friends of Tomoka Basin State Parks are a non-profit organization that promotes activities to conserve, enhance, and interpret the cultural, historic, natural, scenic, and recreational resources of the Tomoka Basin Sate Park right here in Ormond Beach!
To learn more about their mission and what they do, visit their website:
https://www.floridastateparks.org/parks-and-trails/tomoka-state-park/friends-tomoka-basin-state-parks
